contrary scalar negator: other than ...; not ...; a scale or set is implied.
discursive: metalinguistic negator.
attached to cmavo to negate them; various negation-related meanings.
tense interval modifier: characteristically/typically; tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
$x_1$ is a logical 'NOT' statement resulting from the (multiplicative) negation of/applying the 'NOT' operator to $x_2$ (du'u); $x_1$ is the logical negation/negative of $x_2$.
column3: $x_1$ and $x_2$ have mutually opposite truth values. This word is useful for producing "'NOR' statement" from {kanxe}, for example. See also: {na}, {nai}. This is to {na} or {nai} approximately as {kanxe} is to {je}.

column2: $x_1$ (number) is the century notation of the date of event/state $x_2$, in system $x_3$.
column3: {nanca} zei {xecto} zei {detri}. See {de'i'a} for BAI. See also {na'acto}.

column2: $x_1$ (number) is the date/day notation of the year of event/state $x_2$, in system $x_3$.
column3: {nanca} zei {djedi} zei {detri}. As default, the number $x_1$ is counted from the first day of the year. See also {detke'u}.

column2: $x_1$ (number) is the year notation of the date of event/state $x_2$, in system $x_3$.
$x_1$ (number) is the week notation of the year of event/state $x_2$, in system $x_3$.
column3: {nanca} zei {jeftu} zei {detri}. As default, the number $x_1$ is counted from the first week of the year. See also {detke'u}.

column2: $n_1$ is the annual report of company/corporation/organization $k_1$.
$x_1$ is of the same/similar age as $x_2$
$x_1$ is older than $x_2$ by  $x_3$ (li) years
$x_1$ is a toaster
$n_1$=$p_1$ is a pizza/pie/sandwich/taco/burrito/pirozhki with topping/ingredients $p_2$ and bread of type $n_2$=$p_3$.
$x_1$ is a quantity of noodles.
$x1$=$s1$ is a crumb of bread $x2$=$n1$ from grain $x3$=$n2$
$s_1$ is a crumb of bread $n_1$ made from grains $n_2$.
$x1$=$s1$ is a loaf of bread of grains $x2$=$n2$
$z_1$ bakes bread/cake/pastry $z_2$=$n_1$ from ingredients $z_3$.
$x_1$=$f_1$ mathematically(/experimentally?) finds/solves for the value of $x_2$=$f_2$
column3: Useful for "find x", etc.. If one treats functions themselves as "numbers" in some contexts (which is perfectly reasonable), this word could also plausibly be used in the sense of, for example, "find the unique function that satisfies [criteria]".

column2: $c_1$ is characterized by numbers; $c_1$ is digital.
$l_1$ is a numeral (single symbol) in system $l_2$ representing $l_3$=$n_1$.
column3: If not specified $l_2$ defaults to the Arabic numerals in Western scripts. See also {nacysni}.

column2: $x_1$ (number) is the least element/minimum of the set (of numbers) $x_2$ under (partial) ordering $x_3$
column3: x1 must be a set. If this word is being used as a function ($min$), common but lazy mathematical practice allows for speaking of "the minimum of a function" (including sequences) or to constrain the minimum with respect to certain variables, but these constraints can and properly ought to be incorporated into the definition of the set of which the minimum is being taken. This word is not limited to purely mathematical usage and the set can be defined loosely (such as in "the minimum legally acceptable wage" wherein the set x2 is understood to be the set of all legally acceptable wages). The minimum x1 must belong to set x2; compare with:  {zmaraimecna'u} (infimum). See also: {nacyzmarai}.

column2: $x_1$=$n_1$=$c_1$ is a numerical identifier of $x_2$=$c_2$, used by $x_3$=$c_3$.
$x_1$ is a vector of dimension $x_2$ with coordinates $x_3$, $x_4$, $x_5$, ...
$x_1$ is an $x_2$ by $x_3$ vector array/matrix of vectors $x_4$, $x_5$, $x_6$...
$x_1$ (number) is the arithmetic mean of number sequence/set $x_2$
$x_1$ is the absolute value/norm of $x_2$.
$b_1$ counts numbers $n_1$=$p_1$ out aloud.
$p_1$ is a question about a number, asked by $p_3$ to $p_4$.
$s_1$ is a numeral of number $s_2$=$n_1$ to observer $s_3$
$x_1$ (quoted text) is the text that stands for the number $x_2$ in language $x_3$
$x_1$ (number) is the greatest element/maximum of the set (of numbers) $x_2$ under (partial) ordering $x_3$
column3: x1 must be a set. If this word is being used as a function ($max$), common but lazy mathematical practice allows for speaking of "the maximum of a function" (including sequences) or to constrain the maximum with respect to certain variables, but these constraints can and properly ought to be incorporated into the definition of the set of which the maximum is being taken. This word is not limited to purely mathematical usage and the set can be defined loosely (such as in "the maximum number of people whom I permit to be invited" wherein the set x2 is understood to be the set of the possible acceptable numbers of guests allowed by the speaker). The maximum x1 must belong to set x2; compare with:  {mecraizmana'u} (supremum). See also: {nacmecrai}.

column2: $x_1$ is more difficult/harder than $x_2$ for $x_3$ by amount $x_4$
$x_1$ is the most difficult among $x_2$
$c_1$=$n_1$ is a big problem/crisis for $n_2$ in situation/task/inquiry $n_3$.
$x_1$ is recourse of $x_2$ to do/achieve difficult situation $x_3$, which is difficult by standard $x_4$
$x_1$ is a counterexample of property $x_2$, normally exemplified by set $x_3$
$x_1$ is an exception/the only one without property $x_2$ among $x_3$
$l_{1}=n_2$ is an Indian lotus/sacred lotus/bean of India (Nelumbo nucifera) [plant/flower/herb], with nuts $n_{1}$,  of strain/cultivar  $l_{2}$ , symbolizing $l_3$ to culture/religion $l_4$.
column3: The Linnaean binomial Nelumbo nucifera (Gaertn.) is the currently recognized name for this species, which has been classified under the former names, Nelumbium speciosum (Willd.) and Nymphaea nelumbo, among others. See also {latna}.

column2: $j_1$=$n_2$ is a patriot of nation $n_1$.
$cr_1$ is a pixie [tiny, winged mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion $cr_2$
$x_1$ is a pegasus/winged horse.
$x_1$ is a samara of $x_2$ for producing offspring $x_3$.
$z_1$ is folk music performed at/by $z_2$ (event), originating in group of people $n_2$.
$x_1$ is turned off / deactivated / not operational for function $x_2$
$x_1$ turns off / deactivates $x_2$
$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains crouton(s) made from bread(s) $x_2$.
$x_1$ (du'u: proposition or kau-question) cannot be assigned a definite truth-value or answer
column3: Brivla form of {na'i}. i.e. $x_1$ is something one would answer {na'i} to. Useful sumtcita places include {ni'i} for the logical reasoning for $x_1$ being na'itfa, and {va'o} for the conditions / contexts where $x_1$ is na'itfa. See {jo'atnu}

column2: Same function as {na} but with the additional meaning that the sumti in the bridi have no prior experience together.
column3: mi na'ai prami la .rikis .martn. means "mi na prami la .rikis .martn." with the additional information that I do not know who Ricky Martin is (so I cannot like nor dislike him, nor have really any other substantial relationship with him which is based on experience).
column6: not - due to lack of experience

column2: not a number
converts an unevaluated mekso expression into a sumti referencing its evaluated result (if sensible/defined)
column3: For example, would be prefixed to {ke'a} in {xe'au}-NOIhA clauses in order to reference the bracketed (unevaluated, formal) subexpression's evaluated result. In some sense, this word plays inverse of/to {me'o}, but may see less general use since expressions are typically evaluated at the end of mekso utterances. (Thus, this word may find its greatest amount of usage within mekso expressions before they are concluded and evaluated.)
column6: the evaluated result of mex expression

column2: negation sumti qualifier: something other than.
space direction: not towards specified point, contrary negation; direction modal.
Contradictory negation of a predicate
column3: The quantifier negation laws can be stated as: naku ro da zo'u da broda .ijo [su'o] da zo'u da na'ei broda, naku [su'o] da zo'u da broda .ijo ro da zo'u da na'ei broda.

column2: modal aspect: has never, and perhaps cannot; other-than-demonstrated-ability.
logical connective: bridi-tail afterthought conditional/only if.
selbri: repeats preceding bridi while denying it as false; pro-assign values are unchanged.
$c_1$=$n_2$ chirps/makes sound/stridulates $c_2$ rubbing/chafing together wings [body-part] $n_1$ expressing $c_3$ (property)
nylon
nafselte'i modal: except...
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought conditional/only if.
$x_1$ is a male/buck of species $x_2$ evidencing masculine physical/biological/genetic trait(s) $x_3$ (ka); $x_1$ is masculine.
column3: See also {fetsi}, {bersa}. For culturally male traits, see {jikynakni}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the wing [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: lateral supporting surface].
$x_1$ is invariant/unchanged by/symmetric/symmetrical/unaffected under transformation/effect/exchange/operation/external change $x_2$ in property $x_3$ (ka).
$x_1$ is Monday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$g_1$ is a carrot of variety $g_2$.

$x_1$=$n_1$=$g_1$=$c_1$=$ka_3$ is a baby-cut carrot, which is small in property/dimension(s) $x_5$=$c_2$ as compared with standard/norm $x_6$=$c_3$, cut by tool/blade $x_2$=$ka_1$ from carrot $x_3$=$ka_2$=$n_1$, which is of variety $x_4$=$g_2$.
column3: Baby-cut carrots are not to be confused with baby carrots.

column2: $x_1$ is an orange of variety $x_2$.
$j_1$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of orange juice made from orange/oranges $j_2$=$ni_1$.
$ci_1$=$cu_2$ is an American robin of variety $ci_2$
column3: Turdus migratorius. This is not the European robin.

column2: $x_1$ is a peach [fruit] of species/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is the abstract color orange
column3: The gismu {narju} refers to objects which are orange, but not the color orange itself.  This lujvo serves the latter purpose.  See also {skari} {zilska}

column2: $c_1$ is a god (specifically, male deity) of people(s)/religion $c_2$ with dominion over $c_3$ [sphere].
column3: In English, "god" can be either genderless or male (depending on context and contrast), while specifically indicating a female deity by use of the word "goddess". In order to correct this imbalance, Lojban is equipped with {fetcei} and {nakcei} (among other words) for the variously characterized deities, whereas {cevni} makes no implications about the gender of the deity. Cf. {fetcei}, {nakni}, {cevni}, {lijda}, {krici}, {censa}, {malsi}. Recommended to be used only use when contrasted with {fetcei} or masculinity of the deity is to be emphasized/important.

column2: $c_1$ is androphilous [sexually attracted to men] in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.
column3: This word is only about sexual interest in males; other sexuals interest are irrelevant. See also {fetcinse}, {naknakcinse}, {mitcinse}, {dutcinse}.

column2: $n_1$=$f_1$ is an uncle of $f_2$ by bond/tie $f_3$.
$c_1$=$f_1$ is male and androphilous/gay/bisexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$
column3: This word is about male homosexuality and bisexuality. See also {nakcinse}, {fetfetcinse}, {mitcinse}, {relcinse}.

column2: $f_1$=$n_1$ is an unmarried man under law/custom/tradition $s_3$.
$x_1$=$t_1$ is boxer shorts/boxer briefs/briefs/jockstrap (male genital underwear), serving purpose $x_2$=$t_3$
column3: Male genitalia/crotch/penis-covering type of underwear. Needn't be worn by male/man/boy but garment need be made for male genitalia/pubic region in some manner (see {fetpibyta'u}/{pibyta'u} for female/non-defined counterpart). Cf. {nerta'u}, {taxfrbikini}, {tatyta'u}.
column6: boxer briefs;boxerbriefs;boxers;boxer shorts;briefs;g-string;jockstrap;loose boxers;male undergarment;male underwear;string;tanga;thong;tight boxers

column2: $p_1$ is a/the penis of $p_2$=$n_1$.
$x_1 = t_2$ is attracted to males in property/manner/capacity $x_2 = t_3$ (ka), where maleness is determined by evincing masculine traits/according to standard $x_3 = n_3$ (ka).
column3: $x_2$ can be used in order to indicate romantic attraction, sexual attraction, etc., among other things; for the most part, similar-species-ness is assumed, so use $x_2$ in order to indicate alternatives (such as a human being attracted to male cats for pets). This word does not exclude the possibility of being attracted to non-males in any manner or property, including the one given for this $x_2$. In the context of $x_2$ = lo ka gletu, this word includes heterosexual females (assuming gender binary), homosexual males, bisexual and pansexual people, male-attracted trans people, etc.
column6: attracted to males;attracted to men;like men

column2: $si_1$ is feminism, the idea that females and males are alike in quality $sm_3$, as thought by $si_2$.
$x_1$ is a gamete of male $x_2$
$c_2$ is semen containing $s_1$, secreted by organism $c_1$=$s_2$
$x_1$ is a husband of $x_2$ (spouse) according to marriage law/custom/tradition $x_3$.
$x1$ is/demonstrates/exhibits sexual orientation toward males in situation $x2$ by standard $x3$
column3: In a gender binary, this word covers half of each heterosexuality and homosexuality. It is not strict (in other words, bisexuals are both male- and female-attracted). Could be useful for transexuals with a definite preference, as well. See also: {fetytricinse}

column2: $t_1$ is a patriarch of people/territory/domain/subjects $t_2$.
$x_1$ is a male teacher of sexuality to audience $x_2$.
$bi_1$ unrolls under condition $bi_3$.
$ba_{1}$=$bl_{1}$ is a non-big boat for carrying $bl_{2}$, propelled by $bl_{3}$, in property/dimension(s) $ba_{3}$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $ba_{3}$.
$x_1$ improvises $x_2$ (ka) for purpose/goal/to end $x_3$
$b_1$=$n_1$ is gentile.
$k_1$ is an atheist.
$x_1$ is uninteresting to $x_2$.
$x_1$ is senior/older/other than young by standard $x_2$.
$t_1$=$c_1$ is a fetus with mother $t_2$ and father $t_3$.
$x_1$ is moderate in respect of $x_2$ by standard $x_3$
$f_1$ [member] is uncommon/atypical/unusual in property $f_2$ (ka) among members of $f_3$ (set).
$x_1$ (event) is an event that doesn't happen/occur/take place
$x_1$ is inattentive towards/distracted/inadvertent of object/affair $x_2$.
$x_1$ fidgets with $x_2$.
$j_1$ is inattentive towards/distracted from object/affair $j_2$.
$d1$ does not knows fact(s) $d2$ (du'u) about subject $d3$ by epistemology $d4$
column3: This is the proper meaning of agnostic: gnostic - knowledge, a - without. The word is not limited to just religion, and does not describe a position of belief, although it can be used in this context: agnostic theism, agnostic atheism, etc.

column2: $k1$ is unable to do/be/uncapable of doing/being (event/state) $k2$ under conditions $k3$ (event/state)
column3: From la berenstein cribe 2020/11/17 See also {na'e}, {kakne}

column2: $p_2$=$t_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of amorphous carbon.
$m_1$ is not less than/more than or equal to $m_2$ in property/quantity $m_3$ (ka/ni) by amount $m_4$
column3: From la berenstein cribe 2020/11/17 See also {na'e}, {mleca}, {zmadu}

column2: $m_{1}$ is ugly to $m_{2}$ in aspect $m_{3}$ (ka) by aesthetic standard $m_{4}$.
$s_1$ is an approximant consonant with place of articulation $m_2$=$m_3$ and phonation $x_3$.
$x_1$ is incomplete/unfinished in property $x_2$ by standard $x_3$ .
$x_1$=$j_1$ thinks that $x_2$=$n_1$ and $x_3$=$n_2$ (du'u) may both be true about $x_4$=$j_3$, on grounds $x_5$=$j_4$; $x_1$ thinks that $x_2$ and $x_3$ are logically compatible.
$x_1$ [body-part] is the male genital cavity of individual $x_2$
column3: It belongs to a male (sperm-bearer). It is the "vagina-like" organ into which gynosomes may be inserted during mating; this similarity is due to its role in intercourse (being penetrated), and not due to its role in producing certain gametes or hosting embryos. See also: {vibnrbarpinji}

column2: (adverbial) bridi contradictory negator; "it is not true that...."; negates the bridi as well as any other adverbial or quantifier located on its right.
$b_1$=$n_1$ is a bull of species/breed $b_2$.
$d1$ does not know if a god(s) exist; d1 is agnostic.
$c_1$ is lay (non-professional) in event/activity $c_2$ by standard $c_3$.
$c_1$ abstains from eating $c_2$; $c_1$ fasts.
$x_1$ is a winged or once-winged insect
column3: A member of taxon Pterygota. Includes stages and morphs without wings. See {cinki}, {nalci}, {vofli}.

column2: $t_1$ is a quantity of smokeless tobacco/tobacco-based product of/from species/strain $t_2$
column3: All tobacco and tobacco-based products, but not merely nicotine-based products (e.g. pharmaceutical), not intended for smoking e.g. dipping/chewing/dissolvable tobacco, snuff, snus, tobacco gum, iqmik, naswar, gutka, toombak, shammah, etc. Cf. {tanko}, {danmo}, {sigja}.

column2: $x_{1}$ does not want/desire $x_{2}$ (event/state) for purpose $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is incorrect/not right in property/aspect $x_2$ (ka) in situation $x_3$
$x_1$=$d_1$ is a period of $x_2$=$d_2$ non-working days/vacation days/holidays for worker $x_3$=$g_1$ at job $x_4$=$g_2$
$dji_1$=$dju_1$ desires/wants/wishes unknown era $dji_2$=$c_1$=$dju_3$ (event/state) characterized by $c_2$ (event/property/interval/idea) for purpose $dji_3$. $dji_1$=$dju_1$ is nostalgic.
column3: Typically refers to the melancholy desire to live out an era that happened before the subject was born, or to live in a place where one has never been.

column2: $c_1$=$x_1$ is a quantity of decaffinated coffee/coffee [beverage] without caffeine.
$m_1$ forgets fact/memory $m_2$ about subject $m_3$.
column3: Cf. {na'e}, {morji}, {tolmo'i}.  Assumes that {morji} refers to a state i.e. 'remember'= 'retain in memory'.

column2: $n_1$ is not a number
$x_1$ is a human who is neither a woman nor a man.
column6: neither man nor woman;non-binary-gendered humanoid person

column2: $p_1$ gives consent/agreement/sanction to $p_2$ (person/force ind./mass) about $p_3$ (abstract).
$x_1$ is irrelevant/unrelated to $x_2$; $x_1$ is arbitrary in relation to $x_2$ [object of comparison; context or referent].
column3: Also 'random' in the sense of something that is unexpected in a particular context. Does not mean 'random' in the sense of patternless or unpredictable (the primary sense of {cunso}). If $x_1$ is an utterance or sign, nalra'a does NOT mean that it is entirely meaningless ({smucau}), but that it does not provide any outward indication of what thing it signifies if its meaning is not already known. See also {srana}, {sinxa}, {smuni}, {ckini}, {mifra}, {ckaji}. Derivative words include {nalra'aselkai} 'arbitrariness', {nalra'acme} 'arbitrary name', {sranycme} 'nonarbitrary name', {smura'asni} 'sign whose form is related to or indicates its referent'.
column6: arbitrary;irrelevant;out of place;out-of-place;out of place in;out-of-place in;random;unassociated;unassociated with;unconnected;unexpected;unnecessary;unrelated;unrelated to

column2: $x_1$ does not repeat/reoccur/recur; $x_1$ only happens once.
column6: happen once;happens once;not happen again;not recur;not reoccur;one-time;one-time event;one-time occurrence

column2: $r_1$ leaves $r_2$ alone/in peace.
$g_1$=$r_2$ is tranquil/happy about $g_2$=$r_1$.
$x_1$ is an odd number (integer not divisible by 2).
$n_1$ (li) is an integer number that is not a multiple of two by an integer; $n_1$ is an odd number.
$c_1$=$t_1$ in activity/state $c_2$ exhibits/performs/expresses non-binary gender $c_3$=$t_2$ (ka) by standard $c_4$.
column3: $x_1$ exhibits/performs/expresses a gender that does not adhere to a binary gender norm/standard. Cf. {reltracinse} (binary gender). See {tracinse} for definition of gender.

column2: $x_1$ is a non-human animal of species/taxon $x_2$
column3: This is frequently what is meant by just "animal" in English. See also {danlu}.

column2: $c_1$ does not eat meat $c_2$=$r_1$; $c_1$ is a (lacto-ovo-)vegetarian.
column3: See also (ethical) vegan (={nardalprapli}), dietary vegan (={stagycti}), ovo-vegetarian (={sovjvestagycti}), lacto-vegetarian (={ladjvestagycti}), herbivore (={spacti}).

column2: $r_1$ (NU) is casual, not formal/ceremonial.
$x_1$ is unconscious/not aware of $x_2$ (object/abstract).
column3: This is unconsciousness wrt a specific thing ($x_2$); widen for generalized unconsciousness. This may more or less include (some aspects of) sleep, but sleep is a very specific and complex process, and most forms of unconsciousness - let alone a simple and narrowly-specified lack of awareness - do not function in a manner which is even remotely similar to sleep. For generalized unconsciousness, use "{sojnalsanji}". This is NOT "subconscious" in many meanings or contexts. See also: {sipna}.

column2: $t_1$=$c_1$ is afraid of saying syllable(s) $c_2$=$sl_1$ of language $sl_2$ to $c_3$ via $c_4$ because they believe that saying them is not necessary for continuing state/process $sa_2$ under conditions $sa_3$
$x_1$=$c_2$ is uninterested in $x_2$=$c_1$.
$j_2$ is uncooked/raw.
$x_1$ is wingless/has no wings.
$x_1$ is wingless/has no wings.
$r_2$ is calm/untroubled about $r_1$ with result $r_3$.
$x_1$ is raw/crude/unprocessed
$x_1$ (event/state) is unhindered by $x_2$ (event/state) due to quality $x_3$ (ka).
$f_1$=$n_1$ is unmarried under law/custom/tradition $s_3$.
$s_1$ is dishonest/disingenuous to $s_2$ about $s_3$.
$s_1$ (agent) is relentless/unceasing in activity/process/state $s_2$.
$c_1$=$t_1$ is withdrawn, feeling emotion $c_2$ about $c3$=$t_3$ from $t_2$.
$x_1$ (event/person) is unimportant/insignificant to $x_2$ (event/person) due to/in aspect $x_3$; $x_2$ doesn't care about $x_1$'s $x_3$-ness.
column3: I found myself saying [{na'e} {vajni}] very often and thus thought that it'd be nice to have a lujvo for it.

column2: $p_1$ is bikeshedding about lujvo $l_1$ expressed by $p_3$ to audience $p_4$ on grounds (du'u) $x_5$
column3: Bikeshedding is the phenomenon of delaying decisions about an important topic in favor of decisions about ancillary topics, e.g. procrastinating decisions about building a house in order to decide the color of the attached bike shed. From {na'e} {vajni} {lujvo} {bo} {pinka}.

column2: $x_1$ is any referent of $x_2$ ; $x_2$ has a set of referents, but the difference between the members of the set is not important
column3: One possible interpretation of {xe'e}. (xe'ere lo mu plise) → (re nalvaimenre be lo mu plise); (xe'ere plise) → (re nalvaimenre be ro plise). See {le'elkai}, {itca}, {menre}. Shortening: {nalvaime}

column2: $p_1$ is bikeshedding about subject $p_2$ expressed by $p_3$ to audience $p_4$
column3: Bikeshedding is the phenomenon of delaying decisions about an important topic in favor of decisions about ancillary topics, e.g. procrastinating decisions about building a house in order to decide the color of the attached bike shed. From {na'e} {vajni} {pinka}.

column2: $j_1$=$c_1$=$v_1$ (object/person) is free-diving beneath/below/under from $c_2$ (object/water surface) in frame of reference $c_3$, submerged in liquid $j_2$.
$p_1$ is a free-diver.
$x_1$ is unrepentant of $x_2$.
$x_1$ tolerates $x_2$ (event) under conditions $x_3$
$x_1$ is unremorseful of $x_2$.
$x_1$ is absent from $x_2$.
$d_1$ is a bread knife with a blade of material $d_3$.
$x_1$=$k_1$=$n_2$ [agent] tries to solve puzzle/enigma/riddle/charade $x_2$=$k_2$=$n_1$ in game/contest $x_3$=$n_3$
$x_1$=$n_2$ is patient about $n_1$=$x_2$ under conditions $n_3$=$x_3$
$x_{1}$ reflects Central American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a bluff oak (Quercus austrina) of species/strain $x_2$.
$x_1$ is the South African English language used by $x_2$ to express/communicate $x_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ is South Africa.
$b_1$=$c_1$ is a bullock [young male cattle/beef-producer/bovine], of age $n_2$ immature/defined as a bullock by standard $n_3$, of species/breed $b_2$.
$z_1$=$c_1$ is a southwest African/Katanga lion [Panthera leo bleyenberghi] of breed $c_2$.
$x_1$ is south by west of $x_2$ in reference frame $x_3$.
$x_1$ is South Slavic/Yugoslavian in aspect $x_2$.
column3: South Slavic if the aspect is language, else Yugoslavian; see also {slovino}, {bolgaro}, {slovo}, {serbo} (experimental)

column2: $x_1$ is southwest of $x_2$ in frame of reference $x_3$.
$x_1$ is southeast of $x_2$ in frame of reference $x_3$.
$z_1$=$c_1$ is a southeast African/Transvaal lion [Panthera leo krugeri] of breed $c_2$.
$x_1$ is southeast by east of $x_2$ in frame of reference $x_3$.
$x_1$ (event) is insufficient / is not a sufficient condition for $x_2$ to happen
$g_1$ (agent) turns device/apparatus $cab_1$=$can_1$ on.
column3: See also: turn off (={ca'arcadgau}), turned on (={narca'acando}).

column2: $cab_1$=$can_1$ (device/apparatus) is on / operational.
$x_{1}$ in motion/active.
column3: A change in position is not implied. “idling” (not moving), is the negation of this: {cando}.

column2: $x_1$ (event/state/property) is impossible under condition $x_2$
$x_1$=$s_1$=$c_1$ (object/event/idea) is impossible to describe under conditions $x_2$=$c_2$ to audience $x_3$=$s_3$; $x_1$ is ineffable
column3: Indescribeable because of taboo/incommunicable nature (e.g. qualia). Cf. {narcu'i}.

column2: $p_1$ is a (ethical) vegan, not using animal products $c_2$.
column3: See also lacto-ovo-vegetarian (={nalre'ucti}), dietary vegan (={stagycti}), ovo-vegetarian (={sovjvestagycti}), lacto-vegetarian (={ladjvestagycti}), herbivore (={spacti}).

column2: $x_1$ wants $x_2$ to not happen, for purpose $x_3$.
column3: This is usually what one ought say when they say "I don't want you to do that!" Really, one means to say that they want the listener to *not* do something. The desire is affirmative, but the object of desire is negative. See {djica}.

column2: $x_1$ (agent)'s action results in the unintended result $x_2$
$x_1$ (agent)'s action results in the unintended result $x_2$
$x_1$ (event) is an event that doesn't happen/occur/take place
$x_1$ (event) is a sufficient condition for $x_2$ to not happen
under conditions $x_2$, it is possible that $x_1$ (event/state/property) doesn't happen
$x_1$ (event) is not a sufficient condition for $x_2$ to not happen
column3: Probably synonymous with "se cumki". See also {banzu}, {cumki}.

column2: under conditions $x_2$, it is not possible that $x_1$ (event/state/property) doesn't happen / $x_1$ necessarily happens
$x_1$ (du'u) is not true by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $x_2$
column3: Synonymous to {jitfa} under binary truth value logics; may otherwise have a different meaning (e.g. fuzzy logic).

column2: $x_1$ is dirty laundry worn by $x_2$ for purpose $x_3$, dirty with $x_4$.
$x_1$ is an unknown value/argument, unknown to $x_2$
$k_1$ is unable to do/be/uncapable of doing/being $k_2$ (event/state) under conditions $k_3$ (event/state).
$x_1$ lacks property $x_2$.
$x_1$ (property) is not shared by everything among $x_2$ (plural)
$x1$ is a zero-divisor partnered with element(s) $x2$ in structure/ring $x3$, where neither $x1$ nor $x2$ is the zero(-like) element in $x3$
column3: Let structure x3 have commutative group substructure that we name as "additive" and let "0" denote the additive identity thereof in the structure x3. In the set underlying x3 there exist elements x1, x2 ≠ 0 in structure  x3 such that x1*x2 = 0 in structure x3; the partnership aforementioned is thusly defined. See also: {nonsmipi'i}.

column2: $p_1$ is unique/unequaled/unparalleled/unmatched / the only one of its kind.
$x_1$ is useless to agent $x_2$ by the standard of purpose $x_3$

The use of $x_1$ for purpose $x_2$ is discouraged in favour of the use of $x_3$, whose age is less than the age of $x_1$, because $x_3$ is superior to $x_1$.  $x_1$, when used for purpose $x_2$, is deprecated in favour of $x_3$.
$x_1$ (event) causes jamais-vu to $x_2$ (person) using sense $x_3$ under conditions $x_4$
Computer $j$=$1$=$s_1$ is disconnected from [not connected to] computer $j_2$=$s_1$ via medium $j_3$.
column3: Absense of a network connection over $x_3$. $x_3$ could be, for example, a cable or network. See also: {samjo'e}.

column2: $g_1$ (agent) disconnects computer $j$=$1$=$s_1$ from computer $j_2$=$s_1$ in medium $j_3$.
column3: Network connection. $x_4$ could be, for example, a cable or network. Cf. {narsamjo'e}.

column2: $x_1$=$k_1$=$j_1$ is unable to move/paralyzed in body-part $x_2$=$k_2$=$j_2$=$s_2$, under conditions $x_3$=$k_3$=$j_3$
column3: Transient or permanent (but not pseudo-)paralysis (see {sipyjitri'ufri} for sleep paralysis). Cf. {narte'ugaska'e}, {narviska'e}, {nartinka'e}, {narvu'igaska'e}, {narsumnyka'e}, {narka'e}.

column2: $k_1$ is unable to smell/scent (transitive verb) under conditions $k_3$ (event/state).
$k_1$ (non-experiencer) is unable to feel [sensory stimulus] under conditions $k_3$ (event/state).
$t_1$ disobeys/does not follow the command/rule $t_2$ made by $t_3$; (adjective:) $t_1$ is disobedient.
$k_1$ is deaf/unable to hear under conditions $k_3$ (event/state).
$x_1$ (property) is satisfied by at least one thing among $x_2$ (plural)
$k_1$ is blind/unable to see under conditions $k_3$ (event/state).
$x_1$ is an alicorn (winged unicorn) of type/mythology $x_2$
$x_1$ is any referent of $x_2$ ; $x_2$ has a set of referents, but the difference between the members of the set is not important
$x_1$ is the $x_2$-th member of the Fibonacci sequence; $x_1 = F_{x_2}$
For mo'e $x_4$ x in $x_1$ there exist mo'e $x_5$ y in $x_2$ such that x me'au $x_3$ y; for mo'e $x_6$ y in $x_2$ there exist mo'e $x_7$ x in $x_1$ such that x me'au $x_3$ y.
column3: Cf. {me'au}, {mo'e}. Somewhat supercedes {rolsixu}, in that {rolsixu} is {namcixu} for x4=x6=li ro, x5=x7=li su'o.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a googol [$10^{100}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default units).
$x_{1}$ is a googolplex [$10^{googol}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default units).
$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'number' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: PA (PA | lerfu-word)*. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is baklava
$x_1$ is a crêpe of composition $x_2$.
column3: Refers specifically to thin crepes, excluding pancakes.

column2: $x_1$ is a matzo made from grain $x_2$.
$x_1$ is churro, longwise fried dough pastry, of type/variety $x_2$

$x_1$ is $x_2$ (li; no default value assumed, but - unless explicitly overridden - assumed to be expressed with significant figures) years old according to standard of measurement $x_3$; colloquial form: $x_1$ is/has $x_2$ (years (of age)).
column3: At the referenced time (specified by {ca} or the like), $x_1$'s life/existence is an extended event which is thus far $x_2$ years long in duration, as measured according to standards $x_3$ (which might include starting and ending points, choice of frame of reference, ignoring of suspended animation, the definition of the unit 'year' and the use of calendars or continual time, etc.). As a measured quantity, $x_2$ is assumed to be expressed in significant figure form; this feature may be explicitly overridden (possibly with zmico). There are other ways to express this concept, of course, but this word is meant for convenience and brevity, while maintaining clarity (even if not, entirely, formality); it is, essentially, elapsed time of the existence of a being/object in its current state of functionality as measured in years (so, this word is, basically, a more specific form of "{tu'a} $x_1$ {nanca}"). See also: {detmive}.
column6: age in years;years of age;years old

column2: $x_1$ is older than $x_2$ by $x_3$ years.
$x_1$ is younger than $x_2$ by $x_3$ years.
$x_1$ reflects Transcaucasian/South Caucasian culture/politics/language(s)/geography in aspect $x_2$.
column3: Synonymous with {snanu} {zei} {kafkaso} and {transkafkaso}. The Transcaucasia region is usually defined to include Georgia ({sakartyvelos}), Armenia ({xaiaSTAN}) and Azerbaijan ({azarbaiDJAN}), the nations south of the main range of the Caucasus mountains but above Anatolia (see {andolu}). See also {kartuli} 'Georgian', {xai'otso} 'Armenian', {zarbaija} 'Azarbaijani/Azeri', {softo} 'Soviet', {rusko} 'Russian'.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects the Southern Dynasties culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a property satisfied by a number/amount too low for $x_2$ to happen
$x_1$ is a game of backgammon
$x_1$ is a property satisfied by a number/amount low enough for $x_2$ to happen
$x_1$ is a nargileh/hookah for smoking $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a cashew of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is pecan/hickory of species/variety $x_2$.
Namibia
Nāmū (Hawaiian), legendary little people, the silent ones
The Southeastern-Asia Sea (South China Sea).
Master
Mr./Mister
Indicator for moderate or normal attitudinal intensity
column3: Used to indicate the "default" intensity of attitudinals, the intensity that is implied when for example using a bare "ui" (which is in-between "sai" and "ru'e"). Useful mostly together with pei. Derived from cnano.

column2: tense interval modifier: atypically; subjective tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
$x_1$ is a pistachio of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a cashew of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is pecan/hickory of species/variety $x_2$.
weak bridi negation; almost, but not quite.
$x_{1}$ (du'u) contradicts/denies/refutes/negates $x_{2}$ (du'u) under rules/logic $x_{3}$.
column3: Also exception (= {nafmupli}); agentive contradict/deny (= {nafxu'a} or {tolxu'a}).  See also {nibli}, {tugni}, {zanru}, {xusra}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a nation/ethnic group of peoples $x_{2}$; [people sharing a history/culture].
$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of noble gas of type $x_2$ [helium/neon/argon/krypton/xenon/radon].
$x_{1}$ is a canal/channel to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ with route $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is the nose [body-part] of $x_{2}$ with nostril(s)/nasal passage(s) $x_{3}$; [metaphor: protrusion].
$x_{1}$ is energy of type $x_{2}$ in form $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is fond of/likes/has a taste for $x_{2}$ (object/state).
$x_{1}$ is in/inside/within $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is on the inside/interior of $x_{2}$ [totally within the bounds of $x_{2}$].
column3: Indicates total containment.  (cf. se {vasru} (for containment that need not be total), {jbini}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {sruri}, {senta}, {snuji}, {bartu}, {diklo}, {jibni}, {jinru}, {setca})

column2: $x_{1}$ logically necessitates/entails/implies action/event/state $x_{2}$ under rules/logic system $x_{3}$.
column10: ni'i;se ni'i;te ni'i;ni'i nai;se ni'i nai

column2: $x_{1}$ is a nighttime of day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is at night/nocturnal.
column3: Tonight (= {cabycte}); tomorrow night (= {bavlamcte}, even when tonight is still in the future); last night (= {prulamcte}).  See also {donri}, {djedi}, {tcika}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of nickel/other metal resistant to oxidation.
convert selbri to mex operator; used to create less-used operators using fu'ivla, lujvo, etc.
tense: refers to current space/time reference absolutely.
non-restrictive relative phrase marker: which incidentally is associated with ...
location tense relation/direction; approximating/next to ...
location tense relation/direction; within/inside of/into ...
pro-bridi: repeats the current bridi.
unary mathematical operator: factorial; a!.
location tense relation/direction; south of.
abstractor: quantity/amount abstractor; $x_{1}$ is quantity/amount of [bridi] measured on scale $x_{2}$.
location tense relation/direction; downwards/down from ...
convert selbri to mex operand; used to create new non-numerical quantifiers; e.g. "herd" of oxen.
{nibli} modal, 1st place                            logically; logically because ...
$x_1$ pertains to Dutch/Netherlandic culture/language/ethnicity in aspect $x_2$
$x_1$ is a nerd/geek (demonstrates esoteric intense interests at the cost of social acceptance) according to standard/within culture $x_2$ with nerdy/geeky interests $x_3$
column3: Modeled on the definition of {mugle}. Some degree of (at least budding) expertise might be implied, but it is not truly necessary. There just has to be a degree of social rejection or isolation and an intense interest about (a) narrow and somewhat obscure subject matter(s). A nerd need not always be socially disconnected, but it should happen at least where $x_3$ is involved or the interest becomes relevant/apparent. On the other hand, nerdiness/geekiness is also a personality (or a trait thereof), some sense, it never does not apply if it ever applies; but there are contexts wherein certain traits do not really emerge/reveal themselves readily. The intensity of interest in $x_3$ should be judged to be excessive and abnornal, to the point of social separation, by/relative to $x_2$.

column2: $x_1$ (vector) is the displacement of $x_2$ (object/point) relative to $x_3$ (object/point; contextless default: origin) in coordinate system/frame of reference/as measured by $x_4$ according to definition/standard/(meta)physics $x_5$
column3: x1 is (four-)vector-valued; it is a function that maps to a tensor (probably a vector or scalar) to a (four-)vector. Units are handled in x1, which will be a (four-)vector of {mitre} or the like. Time of measurement is just «ca» or the argument of the function(s) in x1, or can be defined instantaneously by x4. Proposed short rafsi: -nif-. See also: {nifkemtemsalri}.

column2: $x_1$ (partially) occupies/fulfills niche $x_2$ (this is a specific assemblage of roles, purposes, strategies, characteristics, behaviors, physical forms or traits, interactions with an environment, etc.) via particular method/mode/trait $x_3$, in evolutionary or interaction or social or ecological or conceptual or strategic or physical environment $x_4$; the $x_2$ niche is occupied by $x_1$ in way or via form/fashion $x_3$; $x_2$ is a niche in evolutionary system $x_4$.
column3: Not necessarily biological. Care must be taken when discussing niches broadly because abstraction from a specific niche is required. For a subniche or superniche, use "{kleniclu}". Individual parts or tools of a larger entity (such as wheels on a car or beaks on a bird) could be understood to be valid $x_1$ candidates, but $x_3$ would have to be subparts of them, characteristics of specifically them, or otherwise describe or be related to specifically them (the wheel) rather than the whole (the car); likewise, in multicellular or complex organisms or communal organisms or colonies of organisms, or communities, or societies, or businesses, individual cells or zooids or members of the organization may be said to occupy a niche (be $x_1$) within that structure or organization.

column2: $k_1$ (non-experiencer) is unable to taste under conditions $k_3$ (event/state).
$d_1$=$r_1$ is an animal of species $d_2$ and not a human; $d_1$=$r_1$ is a non-human animal.
column3: Sometimes, in colloquial usage, the word “animal” is understood to exclude humans. “naryremda'u”, rather than “{danlu}” is the correct translation of it. See also: {na}, {remna}.

column2: $p_1$ loves/feels strong affectionate devotion towards the nation/ethnic group $n_2$; $p_1$ is a patriot/nationalist.
$s_1$ is a nationalist political ideology as applied by $t_1$=$p_1$ among/in people/territory/domain $t_2$ based on the works of thinker $s_3$
$x_1$ is approximately equal to $x_2$.
$s_1$ is a sperm of man/male humanoid person $n_1$=$s_2$.
$x_1$ is the word with stands for the number $x_2$ in language $x_3$
column3: E.g. Lojban {pa}, {re}, etc., English "one", "two", etc. See {nacyuensni}

column2: $m_1$=$n_1$ is $m_2$=$n_2$ nanometer(s) / billionth(s) of a meter [metric unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction $m_3$=$n_3$ by standard $x_4$=$m_3$.
$z_1$ is a nanobot performing function $z_2$ under conditions $z_3$.
$cr_1$=$d_1$ is a halter top of material $cr_2$.
column3: A subtype of "tube top" ({jancaucreka}), with a single strap around the back of the neck. Suggested shortest fu'ivla form: ebdrka. Cf. {creka}.

column2: $x_1$ is a swan (genus Cygnus)  of species/strain $x_2$
$j_1$ is the axis (cervical vertebra) of $c_2$
$cr_1$=$s_1$ is a polo-neck garment of material $cr_2$.
column3: Usually a sweater ({nivycreka}), with a close-fitting, round, and high collar that folds over and covers the neck. Suggested shortest fu'ivla form: epcrka. Cf. {creka}.

column2: $k_1$ is a guillotine/executioner's axe for beheading $k_2$.
$k_1$ is a collar/necklace around neck $k_2$=$c_1$ and is made of material $k_3$.
column3: Could refer to collar for pets, or as a decorative thing.

column2: $ci_1$=$cn_2$=$v_1$ is a heron/egret/bittern of species $ci_2$
column3: Members of family Ardeidae are noted for flying with their necks folded.

column2: $j_1$ is a necktie made of material $d_2$ worn by $c_2$.
$x_1$=$n_1$=$z_1$ likes $x_3$=$n_2$ more than $x_2$=$z_2$ does, by margin $x_4$=$z_4$.
$z_1$, more than $z_2$, likes $n_2$ by amount $z_4$.
$n_1$ is most fond of $n_2$=$t_1$ (object/state) from set $t_4$, due to extreme $t_3$ (ka; default ka zmadu).
column3: Cf. {nelci}, {traji}, {plicu'a}. Also: $n_1$ likes/prefers $n_2$=$t_1$ the most out of set $t_4$.

column2: $s_1$=$n_1$ recommends $s_2$=$n_2$ to audience $s_3$.
$x_1$ gives $x_2$ to $x_3$ to reward them for satisfying $x_4$ (ka).
$x_1$ is an energy transporter for beaming $x_2$ to $x_3$ from $x_4$ over path $x_5$
column3: see {nejni} {benji} {bevri} "ko jai gau nenbejbei mi doi skatis"

column2: $x_1$=$m_1$=$c_1$ is lethargic, slow to do $x_2$=$m_2$.
$s_1$ is an energy shield protecting $s_2$ from $s_3$, made of material $s_4$, supported by $s_5$
$r_1$ is a mitochondrion of $r_2$=$s_1$=$j_1$
$g_1$ charges $x_2$ with energy of type $n_2$ from source $x_4$.
$x_1$ is a mane on $x_2$
$x_1$ is inside out
$x_1$ imports $x_2$ to $x_3$ from $x_4$ via $x_5$ .
$x_1$=$b_1$=$n_1$ enters [becomes inside-of] $x_2$=$n_2$ under conditions $x_3$=$b_3$
$c_1$ is a singlet/undershirt/vest of material $c_2$.
$x_1$ puts/inserts $x_2$ in $x_3$
$m_1$ is an internal combustion engine (ICE) driving/propelling/providing power to x2,  in which combusting/burning of $j_1$ takes place internally.
$x_1$ is an entrance/entry/entryway/inlet/way in to $x_2$ for $x_3$ .
$n_1$=$k_1$ enters $n_2$=$k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$ using means/vehicle $k_5$.
$k_1$=$n_1$ is a hallway / indoor street within $k_2$=$n_2$ accessing $k_3$.
$x_1$ is a pair of underpants
$x1$=$t1$=$n1$ is underwear, worn by/on $x2$=$t2$, for purpose $x3$=$t3$, worn under $x4$=$n2$
$x_1$ is a submarine for carrying $x_2$, propelled by $x_3$.
$j_1$ concludes that $n_1$ (du'u) logically implies $n_2$ under rules $n_3$.
$l_1$ is an implicit-abstraction lujvo with meaning $l_2$ and arguments $l_3$ built from metaphor [tanru] $l_4$.
column3: The term “implicit-abstraction lujvo” is specific to Lojban and originates from The Lojban Reference Grammar, chapter 12, section 13.

column2: $x_1$=$n_1$ (idea/fact/du'u) suggests/intimates that $x_2$=$n_2$=$s_2$ (idea/fact/du'u) is true as it appears to $x_3$=$s_3$
column3: From {nibli} {stidi}. Unlike {stidi}, it refers to person's internal logical reasoning about facts, not external suggestion.

column2: $x_1$ (sequence) is a sorted sequence, ordered by relation $x_2$ (binary ka), from unordered set/plurality $x_3$
column3: Same place structure as {porsi}, but specifies that the sequence has been sorted according to some rule. See {cnici}, {porganzu}, {pormei}, {pormoi}

column2: $g_1$ (agent) tidies/cleans up/neatens/straightens $c_1$ in property/quantity $c_2$ (ka/ni).

$x_1$ (vector) is the differintegral (with respect to time) of order $x_2$ of the displacement of $x_3$ (object/point) relative to $x_4$ (object/point/frame of reference; contextless default: the origin in the home frame) in coordinate system/frame of reference/as measured by $x_5$ according to definition/standard/(meta)physics $x_6$, taken with starting point $x_7$
column3: This word uses two experimental gismu (one with an experimental rafsi): {nicfa} and {salri}. If x2 is negative, then x1 is a time-derivative (velocity, acceleration, jerk, etc. (for whole number values)); if it is positive, then x1 is a time-integral (moments); if it is 0, then x1 is displacement itself. The first and last options are the most common. All differintegrals are based on displacement, rather than one of its differintegrals. x1 is vector-valued.

column2: $x_1$ (scalar-valued) is the magnitude of the vector of the differintegral (with respect to time) of order $x_2$ of the displacement of $x_3$ (object/point) relative to $x_4$ (object/point/frame of reference; contextless default: origin) in coordinate system/frame of reference/as measured by $x_5$ according to definition/standard/(meta)physics $x_6$, where the differintegral is taken with starting point $x_7$, in metric/by definition $x_8$
column3: This word uses three experimental gismu (with one experimental short cmavo for one of these): {nicfa} (-nif-), {salri}, {cusna}.

column2: $n_1$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of nickel [Ni].
column3: Cf. {nikle}, which also includes metals resistant to oxidation.

column2: $g_1$=$n_1$ is an exaggerated creature/character (such as a dog made of nickel) of origin $g_2$
$n_1$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of nickel (Ni).
column3: Unlike {nikle}, this brivla is only true for nickel, but it is untrue for other metals resistant to oxidation. See also {jinme}.

column2: $x_1$ is an alveolar nasal sound produced by $x_2$.
column3: Derived from and synonymous with {ny zei sance}. The odd morphological form serves to place the most salient consonant in the stressed syllable.
column6: alveolar nasal;alveolar nasal sound;N sound;voiced alveolar nasal;voiced alveolar nasal stop

column2: $x_1$ is NaNoWriMo/National Novel Writing Month
column3: This is a shortening of {natfikci'ama'i}, similar to how "NaNoWriMo" is a shortening.

column2: $x_1$ is nata de coco/coconut jelly of type/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ (mass) is population/ethnic/racial group that is scattered/separated from their original homeland $x_2$  for reason $x_3$; $x_1$ is diasporic
column3: x3 being whether or not it was related to slavery, imperialism, famine; this is what makes it different from {gugmu'u} which is more voluntary (and possibly more general in meaning). See also {natmi}, {kulnu}

column2: $x_1$ is a two-spirit of species $x_2$ evidencing two-spirited trait(s) $x_3$ (ka).
nata de coco, coconut jelly
Nāwā (Hawaiian), legendary little people, the noisy ones
Mr./Mister
non-restrictive relative clause; attaches subordinate bridi with incidental information, doesn't contain an implicit reference to its head via {ke'a}.
tense interval modifier: generically, as a rule (gnomic aspect)
pro-sumti whose referent's identity is unknown to the speaker
column3: Short for "lo poi'i mi na djuno lo du'u ma kau me ke'a"; e.g. "nau'o jai daspo lo staku" (someone broke the ceramic and I don't know who), "ra zvati nau'o" (I don't know where she is), "ka'e jinga ta'i nau'o" (it's possible to win somehow, but I don't know how).

column2: what is now; refers to current space/time/situation reference absolutely
attitudinal: \n{ne'au} - devoidness of emotion (neutral by absence of emotion)\n{ne'aunai} - overwhelmed by/replete with/overflowing with (seemingly all) emotion
column3: Carries no positive or negative connotations. In some sense, the "empty attitudinal".

column2: double-negative toggle: every odd-counted explicit usage makes negation additive; unmentioned or every even-counted explicit usage makes negation multiplicative.
column3: It applies to the entirety of the current bridi and all future ones until toggled again; multiple but separated usages of this word within the same bridi behave as if they were adjacent. "Additive negation" means that multiple negatives just intensify, but do not cancel, one another. For example in English: "I ain't seen nothin'" means that the speaker is very emphatically claiming to have seen nothing of interest. This is the standard operation for negation in Spanish. "Multiplicative negation" means that negatives cancel, but do not intensify, one another (possibly taking a neutral or abstentional state). "I did not see nothing" in this mode means that the speaker did indeed see something. Note that multiplicative double-negatives are not necessarily equivalent to affirmatives in general. "I like cheese" is an affirmative statement and is not equivalent to "I do not dislike cheese", which is a multiplicative double-negative (and which may indicate a reluctant acceptance of cheese or a neutral feeling toward cheese). In this mode, an even number of negatives in a given statement is not negative and an odd number of negatives in a given statement is not positive. This word applies to all negatives in the text, whether they are free words or rafsi. This word also, but less dramatically, applies to affirmations: in additive mode, multiple affirmatives intensify one another ("I am indeed very much so going!" is a strongly emphasized positive statement); in multiplicative mode, they simply reduce to a single affirmation (for like example, "I am going"). This means that care must be taken: In additive mode, an affirmative marker will partially cancel with a negative particle in some way, reducing its intensity and possibly bringing it to a neutral statement ("I am indeed - not - going" is a neutral statement in this mode, similar to "I may be going"; English does not really have the ability to express such things); in multiplicative mode, an affirmative coupled with a negative simply reduces to the negative, possibly strengthened by a factor equivalent to the intensity of the affirmer ("I am indeed not going" is a clear way of saying that the speaker will not go).

column2: unary mekso operator: $(-1)^x$
column3: Macro for exponentiating -1 by the input, which is an extremely common term. The input can be any number.

column2: strict essentialistic article: «nei'i broda cu brode» = being a broda necessarily entails being/doing brode.
$x_1$ is PA years in duration by standard $x_2$.
column3: Example "pu lo re nei'o" meaning "two years ago". See also {nanca}, {cei'a}, {lei'o}, {jei'o}, {doi'e}, {coi'e}, {moi'e}, {soi'e}.

column2: mekso ternary operator: the generalized incomplete (factorial-extending) Pi function; for input $(X_1, X_2, X_3)$ this word outputs the definite integral of $t^{X_1} e^{-t}$ with respect to t from $X_2$ to $X_3$ (see notes for default values).
column3: This is an explicit generalization of "{ne'o}", in case such is necessary or desirable. By default, $X_2 = 0$ and $X_3 =$ +infty. The output of this function is offset from the factorial by 0 (making this word consistent with "ne'o") and from the Gamma function by 1.

column2: mekso quaternary operator: polygamma function; for input $X_1, X_2, X_3, X_4$, outputs the $(-X_2)$th derivative of Log(ne'o'a($X_1, X_3, X_4$)) with respect to $X_1$.
column3: By default, $X_2 = -1$ (notice the double-negative). Inherits the defaults for/of "{ne'o'a}" (for: $X_3 =$ ne'o'a$_2$, and $X_4 =$ ne'o'a$_3$). The 0th derivative is the identity operator; in order to be consistent with "{salri}", negative-integer-order derivatives (meaning: positive $X_2$) are antiderivatives. $X_2$ being other than a non-positive integer, or $X_1$ being non-real, should require mention or assumption of the cultural default interpretation of the definition of the differintegral operator. "Log" here denotes the primary branch of the natural (base-$e$) logarithm. This is a shift of the polygamma function by 1, so as to be consistent with "{ne'o}". Therefore, the basic digamma function (derived from the gamma, not Pi, function), often denoted "psi$_0 (z)$, is equal to this word's output for $X_1 = z - 1, X_2 = -1, X_3 = 0, X_4 =$ +infty (notice the prevalence of the default parameter values).

column2: unary operator: primorial a#
column3: The product of the first pi$(a)$ prime numbers $p_i$ starting with $p_1 = 2$, where pi$(a)$ is the (not-greater-than-)prime-counting function. Not strictly monotonically increasing unless $a$=$p_j$ for positive integers $j$.

column2: mekso quaternary operator – Pochhammer symbol: with/for input $(X_1, X_2, X_3, X_4)$, this word/function outputs $\prod_{k = 0}^{X_2 - 1} (X_1 + (-1)^{(1 - X_3)} X_4 k)$; by default, $X_4 = 1$ unless explicitly defined otherwise.
column3: For the basic definition, all inputs (especially those which are not $X_1$) should be nonnegative integers; $X_3$ can be further restricted to $0$ (for the falling factorial) and $1$ (for the rising factorial); $X_4 > 0$ will be typical. $X_2 < 1$ yields the empty product, which is typically defined by convention to be $1$, regardless of all other inputs (so long as they are valid/belong to the domain). $X_2$ is the number of terms in the aforementioned defining product and interacts with $X_4$ in somewhat-complicated ways; be careful to avoid multiplying by nonpositive numbers unless such is actually desired (which may break certain recursive formulas); in order to avoid negative terms, enforce that $X_2 < 1 +$ min$($Set$(1, X_1 \% X_4)) + ((X_1 - (X_1 \% X_4))/X_4)$, where: "$\%$" denotes the modulus/remainder (see: "{vei'u}") of its left-hand/first input (here: $X_1$) wrt/when integer-dividing it by its right-hand/second input (here: $X_4$); recall: $x \% y$ in $[0, y)$ for all real numbers $x$ and $y: y > 0$. Also, $X_4 = 1$ by default. See also: "{ne'o}", "{ne'oi}".
column6: ascending factorial;ascending sequential product;descending factorial;descending sequential product;factorial power;falling factorial;falling sequential product;lower factorial;partial factorial;partial n-tuple factorial;Pochhammer;Pochhammer factorial;Pochhammer function;Pochhammer polynomial;Pochhammer symbol;rising factorial;rising sequential product;upper factorial

column2: mekso n-ary operator: append covariant (lower) indices to tensor
column3: Terminated by {te'oi'oi}. Takes ordered input (A, X_1, X_2, …, X_(n-1)), where A is a tensor and X_i is an index with an understood (or elsewhere defined) ordered domain. It appends/assigns X_i to be the ith covariant index of A, which is usually designated as a subscript in the ith position to the right of A. See also: {ga'u'au}. It is probable that Einstein summation notation will be conventionally in effect.

column2: $x_1$ is a number/value such that the abstraction is true, under mathematical system $x_2$; $x_1$ binds to ke'a within the abstraction
column3: Essentially a specialized version of {poi'i} for use with predicated mathematical statements (as an alternative to mekso). See also {ke'a}.

column2: attitudinal: 'how do you do?'
the last sumti having a {ni}-abstraction at its topmost level inside
digit/number: Niven's greatest-exponent prime factorization constant  $lim_(n->∞) (avg_n (H)) ≈ 1.705211…$
column3: This constant is the greatest exponent appearing in the prime factorization of a positive natural number over the ring integers on average. See also: {ni'e'oi}

column2: digit/number: Niven's smallest-exponent prime factorization constant c = zeta(3/2)/zeta(3) ≈ 2.1732543125195541382370898404…
column3: This constant plays a role in the bounding of the infinite sum of the smallest exponents in the prime factorizations of the positive natural numbers over the ring of integers; specifically, it is the coefficient of the √(n) term; Niven's bound more fully is given by n + c√(n)  +  o(√(n)). See also: {ni'e'ei}
column6: Niven's smallest-exponent prime factorization constant c

digit/number: minus sign; negative number); default any negative.

$s_1$ is a nickel–metal hydride battery in containment $s_3$.
$x_1$ is the size of $x_2$ in property/dimension $x_3$ on scale $x_4$.

$x_1$ (unitless/dimensionless number; li) is the specific gravity (density or concentration ratio) of $x_2$ (substance) with respect to/by standard/per unit of density/concentration of $x_3$ (substance), where density/concentration of each substance is being taken per unit $x_4 = nildenmi_3$ at locus $x_5 = nildenmi_4$ of density/concentration type $x_6 = nildenmi_5$.

$x_1$ [possibly dimensionful number] is the local density/concentration of/in $x_2$ (object) per unit $x_3$ at locus $x_4$, of density type $x_5$; $x_2$ measures $x_1$ units of $x_5$ per unit $x_3$ at locus $x_4$.
column3: $x_5$ might typically refer to count - not mass. Not necessarily (although possible) volumetric mass density; could be temporal, per unit area, per unit length, or other ($x_3$); could be non-mass-based (such as for electric charge or probability densities; $x_5$); relative concentration would be a count density ($x_5$) per count of another substance ($x_3$). Can be applied to number/count; thus, the units may vary and in fact the quantity might even be unitless. In a sense, intensities and fluxes are spacial-temporal densities. It is recommended that $x_2$ be a physical entity/object/field or probability distribution in some sense (not merely have physical quality/meaning/value); thus, while this word could be applied to many things described with the word "per", it would probably not make much sense to call velocity a temporal displacement density (although in some contexts it might). Notice that "local" implies derivatives (Calculus differentiation).

column3: Refers to systems (chiefly on the Internet) that keep a running tally of approval-votes, and sometimes disapproval-votes as well. Syn. se {dzaunlai}. See {ma'udzau}, {ni'udzau}, {adzau}

column2: $x_1$ is the average temporal frequency (occurrence per time unit) at which $x_2$ (proposition) occurs/manifests.
$x_1$ is a water lily (Nymphaea) of species/strain $x_2$
$x_1$ is a Persian lime [fruit/tree etc.] of cultivar $x_2$.
column3: Member of species Citrus latifolia. Cf. {nimre}.

column2: $x_1$ is a lemon [fruit/tree etc.] of cultivar $x_2$.
column3: Member of species Citrus limon. Cf. {nimre}.

column2: $x_1$ is a key lime [fruit/tree, etc.] of cultivar $x_2$.
$x_1$ is the totem of clan/people group $x_2$

column3: Species of this genus are noted for their so-called "sex-reversed" organs. See: {vibnrbarpinji}, {nakpibrkevna}.

column2: $x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'paragraph' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: (statement | fragment) (I # (statement | fragment)?)*. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is a dendrite of nerve $x_2$ receiving impulses $x_3$.
$x_1$ nitpicks / criticizes inconsequential fault/flaw $x_2$ in $x_3$ (object or action)
$x_1$ downvotes / "dislikes" / "-1"s $x_2$ in system $x_3$
column3: Refers to systems (chiefly on the Internet) that keep a running tally of approval-votes, and sometimes disapproval-votes as well. See {ma'udzau}, {co'udzau}, {adzau}, {nildzau}

column2: $x_1$ is $x_2$ newton (s) of force (default is 1) by standard $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a time loop process following Novikov self-consistency principle with stages $x_2$
$x_1$=$v_2$=$n_1$ finds it important to be alone in doing/being $x_2$=$n_2$ (event/state/action) for purpose $x_3$=$v_3$; $x_1$ is introverted
column3: This is a zi'evla form of {nokselvai}.

column2: $x_1$ is a Jedi of power / level / rank $x_2$
Ms.
Miss
Sir/Madam

This cmavo precedes a predicate (at least binary) and turns it into an incidental conjunction, which syntactically behaves like JA cmavo. The predicate indicates the relationship between the two connected propositions. Terminator: {te'u}.
scalar negator: not at all, no way
column3: u'ivla. A Lojbanization of Polish "ni chu chu". More intense than {na'e}, but with no implication of polar opposite.

column2: digit/number: absolute zero; nothing; there does not exist; ∄
column3: Mathematically equivalent to {no}, but implies lack of negative values, especially on a scale ({va'e}/{va'ei} e.g.). Equivalent to "{rone'e} {no}". Cf. {no'e'u}, {su'o}, {ro}, {su'oi}, {ro'oi}

column2: Introduces a bridi relative clause, with the scope of {xoi} and the semantics of {noi}
column3: See also {xoi} and {noi}. "ko .{iklki} no'au jalge fa lo nu {kibycpa}" means something close to "do se {koinde} fi lo ka .iklki noi lo nu do ckaji ke'a cu se jalge lo nu kibycpa"

column2: mathematical/mekso binary operator: the zero/identity-element/(primitive (-))constant operator; outputs the identity-element of structure A (contextless default: the additive group of integers) regardless of the input value of B (except blank or ill-defined values)
column3: According to the contextless default, the (contextless default) output will be identically 0. B can be literally anything imaginable (no specific type is required), so long as B is non-empty (not blank) and is well-defined; if these conditions are satisfied, the identity-element of structure A is output; else, this function is undefined. Notice that in Lojban, a blank must be input explicitly; otherwise {xo'o} will fill the argument implicitly. By skipping arguments in this manner (assuming a known default and using implicit elliptical argument-filling features of Lojban), this operator can be reduced to 0-arity. Note that this operator is different from multiplying by 0. See also: {bai'ei}, {ci'o'au}.

column2: $x_1$ is a Persian lime [fruit/tree etc.] of cultivar $x_2$.
column3: Member of species Citrus latifolia. Cf. {nimre}.

column2: $x_1$ is a key lime [fruit/tree, etc.] of cultivar $x_2$.
logically quantified sumti: nothing at all (unless restricted).
negation sumti qualifier: the neutral form/value of.
digit/number: liminal zero; neither positive nor negative
column3: Mathematically equivalent to {no}, but implies existence of both positive and negative values, especially on a scale ({va'e}/{va'ei} e.g.). Cf. {no'ai}, {no'e}, {ma'u}, {ni'u}

column2: incidental/non-restrictive adverbial: converts selbri to bridi adverbial term. The first place of the converted selbri is claimed to be such that the outer bridi satisfies it, and the outer bridi is claimed. {broda noi'a brode} means {lo nu broda ku goi ko'a cu fasnu .i ko'a brode}.
column3: Has rightward scope. Terminator {fe'u}. See also {poi'a}, {poi'o'a}, {noi'o'a}, {soi'a}, {soi}.

column2: PA nonrestrictive/incidental relative clause; attaches to a PA number/numeral/digit with the ke'a referring to that PA number/numeral/digit.
column3: It attaches to the last mentioned PA, which can be only a single digit within a number rather than the entire number itself (if it has digit length greater than one in some base). Thus, beware of grouping. Confer: {poi'a'u}, {jau'au}. The attachment of this word to the immediately preceding word can be overridden by the usage of {xe'au}, which begins bracketing together an utterance/subexpression that will be considered to be the single and whole referent of the clause introduced by this word, the utterance of which also finishes the bracket. There is a proposal to expand the attachment of this word to any word spoken in a mekso utterance (rather than only members of selma'o PA), including members of selma'o VUhU, etc. See also: {noi'au}.
column6: incidental rel. clause for PA;nonrestrictive rel. clause for PA;PA nonrestrictive rel. clause;relative clause

column2: number/interpreted mathematical object non-restrictive clause
column3: It first terminates the immediately preceding expression and immediately forces its interpretation as a mathematical object as far as possible (so an unmodified PA*, BY*, or SYM* constuct (string) is terminated (as by {boi}) and then understood as a number/word; operators are understood as objects as well). Thn it introduces a restrictive relative clause in which {ke'a} refers to the immediately preceding object. This differs from the PA relative clause markers in that it forces the interpretation of the string as much as possible and the resulting meaning/object is the subject. It interprets the maximal immediately preceding string.
column6: mathematical object nonrestrictive rel. clause;number nonrestrictive rel. clause

column2: scalar normative: normal in intensity
connective modifer/limiter
column3: Used for {ji} and other connective questions.  It is preceded by such a connective (question) word and is followed by the set of words or the selma'o name to which the answer is expected/required to belong; the former may be literally a list of cmavo (such as 'zo .{e} ce zo .{a}', meaning that only AND or AND-OR are acceptable responses) or the name of a set of them (such as 'non-logical connectives', 'tanru after-thought connectives', 'symmetric connectives', 'all connectives except .{u}'. etc.). Terminated by {ge'u'i}. For example 'do djica tu'a loi ckafi ji noi'i lu .enai li'u ce lu na .e li'u ge'u'i loi tcati' asks 'Do you want: some coffee, some tea - where your answer can be only the former or the latter?'.

column2: pro-sumti: this paragraph
attitudinal modifier: attribution to the attached sumti
column3: Explicitly attributes the preceding attitudinal to the sumti the attitudinal attaches to. See also {dai}, {da'oi}.

column2: $x_1$ is a member of insect genus Neotrogla, of species $x_2$
column3: Species of this genus are noted for their so-called "sex-reversed" organs. See: {vibnrbarpinji}, {nakpibrkevna}.

column2: Complex zero; $0 = (0,0) = 0 + 0i$.
column3: Make sure that no other PA or other mischievous immediately precedes or immediately follows this word sequence.
column6: complex zero;zero as a complex number

column2: $x_{1}$ is a message/notice/memorandum about subject $x_{2}$ from author $x_{3}$ to intended audience $x_{4}$.
column3: Emphasis on brevity, single or identifiable subject (contrast with xatra: the emphasis in notci is on the single or cohesively focused subject, while the audience is less defined - indeed only an 'intended' audience.  xatra need not have a single or focussed subject - its corresponding place is for 'content'); reminder/memo/note (= {mojnoi}).  See also {xatra}, {nuzba}, {mrilu}, {morji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is magenta/fuchsia/purplish-red [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ (agent) promises/commits/assures/threatens $x_{2}$ (event/state) to $x_{3}$ [beneficiary/victim].
$x_{1}$ is a rural/rustic/pastoral area of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is in the country.
$x_{1}$ is neutral/not taking sides/medial/not towards any extreme on scale/in dissension $x_{2}$.
column3: Also $x_2$ dispute/struggle (though $x_2$ is not limited to disagreements, which is merely one manifestation of scalar or distributed values in which there is a medial position).  See also {midju}, {lanxe}, {milxe}, {mutce}, cmavo list {no'e}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (du'u) is news/tidings/new information about subject $x_{2}$ from source $x_{3}$, to observer $x_{4}$.
digit/number: typical/average value.
non-restrictive appositive phrase marker: which incidentally is the same thing as ...
abstractor: generalized event abstractor; $x_{1}$ is state/process/achievement/activity of [bridi].
convert mathematical expression (mex) operator to a selbri/tanru component.

vocative: 
{nu'e} - promise
{nu'ecu'i} - promise release
{nu'enai} - un-promise.
start forethought termset construct; marks start of place structure set with logical connection.
modal aspect: can but has not; unrealized potential.
elidable terminator: end forethought termset; usually elidable except with following sumti.
letteral for n.
logical connective: sumti afterthought biconditional/iff/if-and-only-if.

attitudinal: 
{o'a} - pride
{o'acu'i} - modesty/humility
{o'anai} - shame.
attitudinal: \n{o'e} - closeness\n{o'enai} - distance.
$x_1$ is alone in event/state/action $x_2$
$x_1$ is an agender humanoid person [not necessarily adult].
column3: Umbrella term for any humanoid person who has opted out of the psychological/social identifier/role scheme of gender. As such, it is a specification of {rempre}/{remna}/{prenu} co-equal with {ninmu} and {nanmu}; it generalizes some of the aforementioned cases. Word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist; use instead "{remna}" or "{prenu}". See also: "{lingeni}", "{ninmu}", "{nanmu}", "{nunmu}", "{remna}", "{prenu}", "{makcu}", "{bersa}", "{tixnu}", "{paznu}", "{nakni}", "{fetsi}", "{dinti}", "{nanla}", "{nixli}", "{verba}", "{vepre}".

column2: $x_1$ reflects Norwegian culture/nationality in aspect $x_2$
$x_1$ are noodles made of $x_2$
$x_1$ reflects Inuit/Eskimo culture/language/people/geography in aspect $x_2$
$x_1$ is 1 [$1*10^0$] of $x_2$ in dimension/aspect $x_3$ (default is units).
column3: This is the null SI prefix, but it does not have a name in English or any truly official SI documentation; so, one meter is equal to one 'nulpa'-meter. {nulpa} = {kamre} {li} {pa}. See also: {grake}, {mitre}, {snidu}, {stero}, {delno}, {molro}, {kelvo}, {xampo}, {gradu}, {litce}, {merli}, {centi}, {decti}, {dekto}, {femti}, {gigdo}, {gocti}, {gotro}, {kilto}, {megdo}, {mikri}, {milti}, {nanvi}, {petso}, {picti}, {terto}, {xatsi}, {xecto}, {xexso}, {zepti}, {zetro}, {kamre}.
column6: 1;base SI prefix;default SI prefix;null SI prefix

column2: $x_1$ is a non-binary humanoid person [not necessarily adult].
column3: Does not imply asexuality/agenderness (or sexuality/genderedness). See discussion associated with "{dinti}" concerning whether this meaning is restricted to "affirmatively nonbinary" or whether it is more general.  Umbrella term for any non-man, non-woman (in some aspect/consideration/standard) humanoid person. As such, it is a specification of "{rempre}"/"{remna}"/"{prenu}" co-equal with and analogizing "{ninmu}" and "{nanmu}"; it generalized some of the aforementioned cases. Word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist or exclusionary; use instead "{remna}" or "{prenu}". See also: "{ninmu}", "{nanmu}", "{remna}", "{prenu}", "{makcu}", "{bersa}", "{tixnu}", "{paznu}", "{nakni}", "{fetsi}", "{dinti}", "{nanla}", "{nixli}", "{verba}", "{vepre}", "{nenmu}", "{nonmu}".

column2: $x_1$ induces $x_2$ about $x_3$ from specific facts $x_4$
$x_1$ is the language/sublanguage that uses no apparent terbri/selbri distinction and is used by $x_2$ to express ideas (not text) $x_3$.
column3: For describing the grammar use {gerna}. See also {uorfopno}, {malgli}, {pirxo}, {lojbo}, {bridi}, {sumti}, {fancu}, {baurnu'uku}, {banmujexe}.

column2: $x_1$ reflects New Zealand culture/nationality/geography/dialect in aspect $x_2$.
$m_1$=$n_1$ is elegant to $m_2$=$n_2$.
$ni_1$=$no_1$ is a lady, considered noble in culture/society/standard $no_2$.
$t_1$=$n_1$ is a regent/monarch of $t_2$ by standard $n_2$.
$x1$ is a monarchal territory/noble territory/regency (territory)/kingdom (territory)/queendom (territory) of ruler $x2$
column3: Not the government, subjects, etc., merely the territory. Of what the territory is can be specified, by various means, within x2 (but not as the main sumti thereof).

column2: $s_1$ is a servant of  sovereign/aristocrat/noble $s_2$=$n_1$ in culture/country $n_2$ with responsibilities $s_3$.
$s_1$ is a throne/ceremonial chair used by noble/aristocratic/elite/high-born/titled in/under culture/society/standard $n_2$.
$ni_1$=$j_1$=$no_1$ is a Duke/Baron/Count/Earl/Marquess/ [titled noble of middle rank] ruling $j_2$ under culture/standard $no_2$.
$ni_1$=$j_1$=$no_1$ is a Duchess/Baroness/Countess/Marchioness/ [titled noble of middle rank] ruling $j_2$ under culture/standard $no_2$..
$x_1$ is a prince, son of king/queen $x_2$ who reigns over $x_3$
$x_1$ is a queen/empress reigning over $x_2$
$x_1$ is the king of $x_2$ by standard $x_3$.
$x_1$ is the queen of $x_2$ by standard $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a princess, daughter of king/queen $x_2$ who reigns over $x_3$
$z_1$ is a palace of/for noble person(s) $n_1$=$z_2$.
$z_1$=$n_1$ the classical music performed at/by $z_2$ (event) originating in culture $n_1$.
$k_1$ is an atheist.
$c_1$ is asexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.
$x_1$ is a Sunday of week $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
column3: Duration. For date, use {jedlno}. Sunday is either day seven or day zero, depending on your perspective.

column2: $x_1$ is undecided/makes no decision about $x_2$.
$x_1$ is alone/lonely/lonesome in state/condition/enterprise $x_2$.
$z_1$ (number) is greater than 0 by amount $z_4$ (number); $z_1$ is a positive number.
$m_1$ (number) is less than 0 by amount $m_4$ (number); $m_1$ is a negative number.
$c_1$ in activity/state $c_2$ exhibits an aromantic orientation by standard $c_4$.
if $x_1$ never happens again, it would be too soon
column3: The Lojban definition doesn't quite mean what the English one does, but it conveys roughly the same idea. The Lojban definition means something more along the lines of "x1 never happening would mean it happening too many times".

column2: $x_1$ never happens in interval $x_2$. $x_1$ happens zero times.
$c_2$ disbelieves in god/deity $c_1$ with dominion over $c_3$; $c_2$ is an atheist.
$x_1$ is available for free/without cost to $x_2$ from provider $x_3$.
$x_1$ is invisible from point-of-view $x_2$.
$j_2$ (du'u) is a mystery for $j_1$, the subject being $j_3$.
$x_1$ is alone in state/condition/enterprise $x_2$
$x_1$ is pointless / futile / useless according to $x_2$
$x_1$ is nonsense/nonsensical to $x_2$.
$x_1$ is the additive inverse of $x_2$.
$x_1$ is shapeless/has no shape
$x1$ is the zero(-like)/additive identity of structure/ring $x2$; often is denoted by ' $0_R$ '  (for structure/ring R, specified by $x2$) or by  '0' when context is obvious
column3: Definition and rules may be specified in the second terbri; this definition does not suppose that the ring is not the 0-ring  (the trivial ring) with the mapping of all multiplications to 0 (in which case, the additive identity is also the multiplicative identity). The usage of "additive" and "multiplicative" in this context are defined by the ring. See also: {pavysmi}

column2: $x1$ is a zero-divisor partnered with element(s) $x2$ in structure/ring $x3$
column3: x1 and x2 are elements of the set underlying x3 and x1*x2=0 in this structure x3 (where "0" denotes the 'additive' identity of the structure ("addition" merely being (one of) its commutative group operation(s))); the aforementioned partnership is so defined. Unlike many textbook definitions, this definition still allows such 0 to itself be a zero-divisor ((so partnered) with any element in the set underlying x3) in x3. See also: {narnonsmikemnonsmipi'i}

column2: $x1$=$t2$ is an element in the set that underlies structure/ring $x2$≈$s3$ that is nilpotent in that structure with nilpotency $x3$=$t3$ (nonnegative integer according to the typical rules)
column3: x3 is the minimum positive exponent such that x1 multiplied by itself that many times (according to the definition of multiplication imposed by and endowing structure x2) is identically the zero(-like) element in that structure; any greater power will likewise be zero(-like). The zero(-like) element is itself trivially nilpotent with nilpotency 1. Warning: This word is for nilpotent elements. Nilpotent groups, for example, should not be referred to by this word except when considered as whole objects that participate as elements in some larger structure. See also:  {nonsmi}

column2: $x_1$ is a Sunday evening of week $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ (property) is not satisfied by anything in the domain of discourse
$x_1$ is lesser or equal to zero by amount $x_2$
$x1$=$b1$ is middle-sized in property $x2$=$b2$ by standard $x3$=$b3$
$c_1$ neither gets $c_2$ from $c_3$ nor puts $c_2$ at $c_3$
$x_1$ is mediocre (in terms of skill) at $x_2$ (ka/activity) by standard $x_3$
$x_1$ is alone in state/condition/enterprise $x_2$

$x_1$ reflects language/culture/nationality/community of the Nordic countries [ Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway, (Baltic states) and Sweden] and their associated territories [the Faroe Islands, Greenland, Svalbard and Åland] in aspect $x_2$.
column3: Also: Nordic/Norse(folk)/Danish/general Scandinavian/northern European/Viking. This generally includes the Baltic Slavs ({ba'alto}), some northwestern Salvs (Polish, Old Prussian), Scandinavians, western Russians/Soviets (and Rus), the Danes in the British Isles, and perhaps the northeastern coasts of Germany, the Germanic Norse, and others. It is not the same as Scandinavian: from the 1850s, Scandinavia was considered to include politically and culturally the countries/cultures of Denmark, Norway, and Sweden only (thus, a subset of no'ordo). This might include western Russia/Rus peoples. Might refer to Vikings and/or older cultures. Includes Iceland, Greenland, Faroese, etc. Confer: {norgo} (specialized and a modern nationality/identity), closely related to but more general than {ska'ando}. For Germanic Norse (which is slightly wider in meaning at present than {dotsmiska'ando}), use {dotsmino'ordo}.

column2: Sir
Madam/Lady
$x_1$ is a 0-some / empty mass / 0-tuple, with members $x_2$ (must be the empty set).
discursive utterance ordinal: zeroth section/chapter ordinal; foreword.
$x1$=$z1$ voluntarily does action $x2$=$z2$=$b2$ to achieve goal $x3$=$z3$
column3: In the sense: Doing something, when refusing would have no repercussions. Unpaid action not implied.

column2: $x_1$ is either infinite or zero in property/dimension $x_2$ to degree (quantity)/of type $x_3$
column3: Infinities and zeros are intimately related.

column2: $x_1$ is massless/is a massless particle
$x_1$ wishes for $x_2$ (impossibility or believed impossibility)
$x_1$ is unconscious; $x_1$ has blacked out.
