column2: $x1$=$r2$ is careless
$x_1$=$c_1$ is quiet and says nothing to $x_2$=$c_3$.
$x_1$ is a singularity of function/object $x_2$ of type/with properties $x_3$;  $x_2$ has a singularity of type/severity $x_3$ at (locus) $x_1$
column3: x3 can be used in order to specify cosmetic/removable singularity, pole (and the degree/severity thereof), and essential singularity; none of these aforementioned options are a default. x1 may be at infinity or in various other spaces.

column2: $x_1$ is greater or equal to zero by amount $x_2$; $x_1$ is a positive number (greater than zero)
$x_1$ is indifferent/neutral/apathetic about event/state $x_2$.
column3: Overlaps in meaning with {norzau}, {norpa'a}, {norpa'i}. See {selnordji} for 'incidental'/'unimportant.'
column6: apathetic;be apathetic;be indifferent to;feel apathetic;feel indifferent;feel neutral about;feel neutral toward;indifferent;neutral

column2: $x_1$ is liminally/neutrally $x_2$ (ka); $x_1$ is between the state of $x_2$ and the state of the inverse of $x_2$
column3: (ko'a norkai lo ka broda) = (ko'a {no'e} broda). Also see {nutli}, {tolkai}

column2: $l_1$ is half-naked; $l_1$ is partly without cover/clothes/[protection].
$m_{1}$ is plain/ordinary-looking (neither ugly nor beautiful) to $m_{2}$ in aspect $m_{3}$ (ka) by aesthetic standard $m_{4}$.
$m_1$ is undead.
$c_1$ exhibits gray asexuality in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.
$x_1$ is indifferent/neutral/apathetic about event $x_2$, expected likelihood $x_3$.
$x_1$ is indifferent/apathetic/dispassionate/uninvolved/unmoved towards/with/by $x_2$.
$x_1$=$c_2$ is disinterested in $x_2$=$c_1$.
$t_1$ is neither quenched from nor thirsty for drink/fluid/lubricant $t_2$.
column3: On a scale between “quenched” and “thirsty”, $t_1$ is roughly at the midpoint. See also: {taske}, {toltaske}, {no'e}.

column2: $s_1$=$v_1$ is an interpretation of $s_2$ recognized by $s_3$ but judged unimportant by $v_2$.
column6: an aside, a not important expression; an obscure interpretation of;obscure interpretation

column2: $x_1$ zviki $x_2$ noi no'e vrude je no'e palci ku'o $x_3$
$x_1$ is morally neutral by standard $x_2$
$xa_1$ is neither sated from nor hungry for food/fuel $xa_1$.
column3: On a scale between “being hungry” and “being sated”, $xa_1$ is roughly at the midpoint of it. See also: {xagji}, {tolxagji}, {no'e}.

column2: $x_1$ is mediocre (in terms of benefit) for $x_2$ by standard $x_3$
$x_1$=$t_1$ has a phobia of $x_2$=$t_2$ (abstraction).
$x_1$ is indifferent towards $x_2$.
$l_2$ is blurry/indistinct/unfocused at location $l_3$
column3: (while L1 is explicitly elided, L4 is equally implicitly elided as being nonsensical in the absence of a physical lens)  This can apply to any bodily sense, e.g, a sound may be unclear.

column2: $c_1$ notes down $c_2$ on display/storage medium $c_3$ with writing implement $c_4$.
$c_1$ announces/proclaims $c_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $c_3$=$n_4$ via expressive medium $c_4$.
$x_1$ is violet-red [color adjective]
$x_1$ is the abstract color magenta
column3: The gismu {nukni} refers to objects which are magenta, but not the color magenta itself.  This lujvo serves the latter purpose.  See also {skari} {zilska}

column2: $x_1$=$s_1$=$j_1$ is a coddled/mollet egg of/from organism $x_2$=$s_2$.
column3: Equivalent to ``sovda poi febvi djacu jukpa ze'a le mentu be li xa''.

column2: $p_1$ expects/looks for the occurence of $p_2$ (event), expected likelihood $p_3$ (0-1); $p_1$ subjectively evaluates the likelihood of $p_2$ (event) to be $p_3$.
column3: The value of $x_3$ is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to $x_1$, and is the basic determinant of whether nulpa'a means something like "hope" or "wish" or "expect", although nulpa'a never carries the connotation of desire; for that connotation see {pacna}. nulpa'a with $x_3$ not very close to 1 has no simple equivalent in English, but for objects/states with negligible expectation it is something like "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is something like "hoping". In both cases, though, the English implication of emotional desire is not present. The value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("{li} {piso'u}" to "{li} {piro}"); not-necessarily desirous wish, not necessarily desirous hope. See also {ba'a}, {djica}, {pacna}, {lakne}, {cunso}.

column2: $x1$=$n1$=$t1$ is a village/[rural town] of area $x2$=$n2$=$t2$, in political unit $x3$=$t3$, serving hinterland/region $x4$=$t4$
$n_1$ is an event of $b_1$ being foolish/silly/stupid in event/action /property (ka) $b_2$.
$x_1$=$r_1$ is the physical cause of shipwreck (event) $x_2$=$nbp_1$=$r_2$ under conditions $x_3$=$r_3$
$x_1$=$n_1$ (event) is a shipwreck/breaking of ship/boat $x_2$=$s_1$=$b_1$ in which it function/capability $x_3$=$s_2$ is compromised/ruined/damaged
$x_1$=$g_1$ (agent) is the agentive cause/intentionally (limited sense) in shipwreck $x_2$=$nbp_1$ (event); $x_1$ shipwrecks/wrecks ship in event $x_2$
column3: The ship being wrecked can be specified in x2.

column2: $x_1$ orders the impeachment trial of $x_2$ over issue $x_3$ within body/by judge/in system/via proceedings $x_4$; $x_1$ formally impeaches (pseudo-legalistic political process) authority $x_2$ for alleged inadequacies $x_3$.
column3: $x_2$ must be some sort of person with or figure of authority; impeachment does not imply criminal trial and is usually an internal process by one part of the government/organization against another with the primary consequences (upon conviction) of a forced loss of said authorities and potential prohibition from regaining certain authorities within the same government/organization. This word does not imply conviction or removal or any other punishment or effect whatsoever. $x_5$ is wide enough to include the process and capacity in which the impeachment is made and the means by which it would be tried.

column2: $x_1$ (event) is the event of cosmic/spatial inflation of universe/space $x_2$
column3: Various technical issues should be considered when employment of this word is being considered.  For example: only (spaital, at least three-dimensional) volume is considered, rapid and great increase is not necessarily implied, no single event is implied, the space itself is expanding and into what is not clear, etc.

column2: $n_1$ is a conversation involving $c_1$(s)  (mass normally, but 1 individual/jo'u possible) about topic/subject $c_2$.
$n_1$ is the killing by $c_1$ of $c_2$ by action/method $c_3$.
$x_1$ is the state of $x_2$'s lack of $x_3$; $x_1$ is the event/situation in which $x_2$ lacks $x_3$; $x_1$ is the state/event of $x_3$'s absence (being absent from) $x_2$.
column3: See also: "{nalzva}" (which refers to being physically not located somewhere specified; "nuncau" is somewhat more general).

column2: $n_1$ is the youth of $c_1$.

$n_1$ is the integration of $b_1$=$c_1$ as a member/element of group/set $c_2$ under conditions $b_3$

column2: $x_1$ is a kanji (Japanese logograph) with kun'yomi (native, Sino-Japanese reading) $x_2$, on'yomi (compound, Chinese reading) $x_3$, with etymology/meaning/radical/s $x_4$.
column3: Merge of {ponjo} + .{anji}. Note that there may be many readings; x2 & x3 should be individual readings, not sets. In the rare case of no readings of particular type, {zi'o} should be used. x4 can be either a meaning, a fully specified set of meanings, a fully specified set of radicals, a single radical, the earlier form of the kanji, stroke order, or even the Chinese equivalent (taking into account that there are minor discrepancies between the Japanese and Chinese forms, and that the simplified Chinese characters are totally different).

$x_{1}$ hopes/wishes for/desires $x_{2}$ (event), expected likelihood $x_{3}$ (0-1); $x_{1}$ hopes that $x_{2}$ happens.
column3: Also: $x_1$ is hopeful of $x_2$; $x_2$ will hopefully occur, as hoped for by $x_1$; the value of $x_3$ is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to $x_1$, and is the basic determinant of whether pacna means 'hope' or 'wish' or 'expect': hoping for objects/states with negligible expectation is "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is "hoping"; when the probability is subjectively near 1, the attitude is described as "expecting"; the value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("{li} {piso'u}" to "{li} {piro}"); wish (= {sotpa'a}), hope (= {sorpa'a}), expect (= {sojypa'a}).  See also {djica}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a part/component/piece/portion/segment of $x_{2}$ [where $x_{2}$ is a whole/mass]; $x_{2}$ is partly $x_{1}$.
$x_{1}$ passes through/penetrates barrier/medium/portal $x_{2}$ to destination side $x_{3}$ from origin side $x_{4}$.
column3: Passing through in both directions (= rolfargre, pagre ... .i so'ivo'ivo'u (and vice versa)).  See also {bitmu}, {denci}, {ganlo}, {kalri}, {vorme}, {pluta}, {canko}, {ragve}.

column2: $x_{1}$ judges/referees/arbitrates/is a judge determining/deciding matter $x_{2}$ (abstract).
column3: $x_2$ includes jei = rule ({jetpai}), ni = estimate ({lairpai}), ka = evaluate ({kairpai} or {vampai}), or nu = referee/arbitrate ({faurpai}); single events of judging including specific decisions/judgements (= {paijdi}, {jetpaijdi}, {lairpaijdi}, {kairpaijdi}, {vampaijdi}, {faurpaijdi}); jury (= {pairkamni}), serve on a jury (= {kamnypai}, as part of mass $x_1$).  See also {cuxna}, {jdice}, {vajni}, {cipra}, {zekri}, {manri}, {mansa}.

column2:
attitudinal: 
{o'u} - relaxation
{o'ucu'i} - composure
{o'unai} - stress.
digit/number: 1 (digit) [one].
{panra} modal, 1st place (parallel; shared property) similarly; in addition to ...
discursive: \n{pa'e} - justice\n{pa'enai} - prejudice.
binary mathematical operator: ratio; [the ratio of a to b].
digit/number: pi (approximately 3.1416...); the constant defined by the ratio of the circumference to the diameter of all circles.
$x_1$ participates in $x_2$ in manner $x_3$
$x_1$ is sad about $x_2$ (event), which has occured contrary to their hopes.
$b_1$ is Esperanto.
$c_1$ evilly laughs.
$x_1$ is an evil counterpart to $x_2$ by moral standard $x_3$, in contrast to $x_2$ having property $x_4$.
column3: $x_4$ is implied to be (lo ka {vrude}) "being good/virtuous", or at the very least (lo ka na'e {palci}). "being not-evil". See {panra}, {bu'a'a}

column2: $t_1$ is a hell (evil-superlative-site) of evil being(s) $p_1$=$r_1$, most evil among $r_3$, evil by standard $p_2$.
$x_1$ is an evil spirit / demon
$t_1$ is the Hell of evil spirit(s) $t_2$=$pa_1$=$pr_1$, evil by standard $pa_2$.
$x_1$ is a demon
$x_1$=$z_2$=$p_1$ is a sin/evil action by $x_2$=$z_1$ for purpose/goal $z_3$, evil/depraved/wicked (morally bad) by standerd $x_4$=$p_2$.
$xl_1$ (agent) tempts $xl_2$ into evil $xl_3$=$p_1$ by influence/threat/lure $xl_4$, said act being evil by standard $p_2$.
$z_1$ sins by doing $z_2$=$p_1$ by standard $p_2$.
$x_1$ is punctuation in orthography/language $x_2$ representing $x_3$
$ci_1$=$p_1$ is a utopian society interrelated by structure $ci_2$.
$p_1$=$c_1$ (quoted word(s)) is a/the patronymic [a personal name based on the name of one's father] of $p_2$=$c_2$ to/used-by namer/name-user $c_3$ (person).
$x_1$ is a paternal grandmother of  $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a paternal grandfather of  $x_2$.

$x_1$ is patrilineal/agnatic to/an agnate of $x_2$; $x_1$ is path-connected to $x_2$ via the fatherhood relation, connected by a graph-path passing through intermediate relations/steps (successive agnates) $x_3$ (ce'o; ordered list).
column3: $x_1$ is a father of the father of the father ... of the father of $x_2$. This word is a zi'evla lujvo ({brapagjvo}) of ".{utka}".

column2: $p_1$=$g_1$ is a constituent country of $p_2$ (sovereign state / supranational body).
$x_1$=$z_1$ is a department store selling/trading (for) $x_2$=$z_2$, with departments $x_3$=$z_3$=$p_1$
$j_1$=$p_1$ gives a verdict $j_2$ (du'u) about matter $j_3$=$p_2$ (abstract).
$x_1$ is a court of law with jurisdiction $x_2$
$c_1$ is a member of jury/judging panel $c_2$=$p_1$=$k_1$ deciding matter $p_2$ in court/judging body $k_3$.
$x_1$ is  fair/just/equitable/impartial/unprejudiced/unbiased in judging/refereeing/arbitrating/determining/deciding matter $x_2$.
$j_2$ is a verdict given by $j_1$=$p_1$ about matter $j_3$=$p_2$ (abstract).
$x_1$ gets promoted to $x_2$ (object, state).
$x_1$ feels orgasm, has orgasmic feeling
$x_1$ is a pair (possibly ordered) of $x_2$ and $x_3$
$x_1$ is broomrape of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of opal from source $x_2$
$x_1$ is a bottle/jar/urn/flask.
$x_1$ is an octopus of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a pika (member of lagomorph genus Ochotona) of subtaxon/type/species/variety/breed $x_2$
column3: Meant for the genus of pikas Ochotona. Appropriately used, cannot include: rodents, shrews, elephant shrews; related to rabbits. The family Ochotonidai is presently known as monopyhletic. See also: {oxtonidai}, {ractu}.

column2: $x_1$ is a pika (member of lagomorph family Ochotonidae) of subtaxon/type/genus/species/variety/breed $x_2$
column3: This is for any member of the family (which presently has only one recognized genus). See also: {oxtona}. Appropriately used, does not include: rodents, shrews, elephant shrews; related to rabbits. See also: {ractu}.

column2: $x_1$ is a mereological object which overlaps with mereological object $x_2$ via at least object $x_3$ in universe of discourse $x_4$.
column3: There exists an object $y$ in $x_4$ such that $y$ is a part of $x_1$, and $y$ is a part of $x_2$; moreover, $x_3$ is such a $y$. Sometimes, this definition is restricted so that objects which are parts of all things in the universe are not candidates for $y$. See also: "{pagbrjonlapi}", "{pagbu}", "{klesrverlapi}".

column2: North-Atlantic Treaty Organization.
Ottawa
ocha/tea ceremony

attitudinal: 
{o'u } - relaxation
{o'u cu'i} - composure
{o'u nai} - stress.

attitudinal: 
{o'u } - relaxation
{o'u cu'i} - composure
{o'u nai} - stress.
$x_1$ participates in $x_2$; $x_1$ takes part in $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a mereological object which underlaps with mereological object $x_2$ via at least object $x_3$ in universe of discourse $x_4$.
column3: There exists an object $y$ in $x_4$ such that $x_1$ is a part of $y$, and $x_2$ is a part of $y$; moreover, $x_3$ is such a $y$ (but others may exist). Sometimes, this definition is restricted so that objects such that all things in the universe are part(s) of them are not candidates for $y$. See also: "{pagbrkuclapi}", "{pagbu}".

column2: Ohio
letteral for o.
column3: Synonymous with the original CLL definition of .{obu}.

column2: sumti: explicitly marks respective use as in "THEY read THEIR (respective) books".
among (with a share for each)
digit/number: universal parabolic constant $P = √(2) + Log_e(1 + √(2)) ≈ 2.295587$
number/quantity: 18 [eighteen].
number: $1*10^{18}$, exa, quintillion; symbol: E
number/quantity: 13 [thirteen].
discursive: \n{pa'e } - justice\n{pa'e nai} - prejudice.
$p_1$=$k_1$ is a jury/judging panel deciding matter $p_2$ in court/judging body $k_3$.
$c_1$=$t_1$=$p_1$ is the judicial branch of the government of people/territory/domain/subjects $t_2$.
$x_1$ reflects/pertains to the Pacific Ocean region/culture/history/geography/identity/[nationality] in aspect $x_2$.
column3: Pertains to peoples or things bordering, embedded in (or on an island in), submerged in, located under or on the bottom of, or going through/over the Pacific Ocean as well. "Trans-Pacific" is closely related to this word. See also: ".{atlanto}", ".{indi'o}", ".{antarktiko}".

column2: Dad
column3: The rafsi for {patfu} used as a familar name. See also {mam}, {bes}, {tix}, {bun}, {mes}.

column2: scalar question: how very...?
column3: Asks for NAhE. See http://mw.lojban.org/papri/zipcpi:_scalar_modifiers . See {pei'a}. Note: As many of the NAhE in this system are new and may be unfamiliar, NAI/CAI may be substituted for the answer instead.

column2: Digit/number: pi (denoted "π"; approximately 3.1416...); the constant defined by the ratio of the circumference to the diameter of all circles in Euclidean space.
column3: This word is intended to be an alternative to but synonymous with both "{pai}" as defined in the original Lojban baseline grammar, as well as the related proposed meaning of "{pi'au}". Consequent to the latter, it is part of a proposal to move "{pau}" to "{pai}" and "{poi'a}", "{noi'a}", "{soi'a}" to "{pau}", "{nau}", and "{sau}" resp. See also: "{tau'u}". For reference: "{tcekitau}", "{tcekitaujau}", "{tcekitaujei}";  https://mw.lojban.org/papri/ce_ki_tau_jau .

column2: number/quantity: 1,000 expressed with comma.
$x_{1}$ is evil/depraved/wicked [morally bad] by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ are pants/trousers/slacks/leggings [legged garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a tray/platter/flat container [pan/sheet/griddle] of contents $x_{2}$, and made of material $x_{3}$.
column3: Also pallet, when used for carrying rather than support on the ground; a tray is flat-bottomed and shallow or without a rim, and is generally portable.  See also {tansi}, {patxu}, {palta}, {ckana}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a plate/dish/platter/saucer [flat/mildly concave food service bed] made of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a pump/injector [tool/apparatus] pumping/inserting fluid $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ from $x_{4}$ by means $x_{5}$.
column3: $x_2$ fluid may be liquid or gas; $x_5$ may be a force; a pump generally causes a pressure gradient, such that $x_3$ is a place of lower pressure, $x_4$ a place of higher pressure.  (cf. {gapci}, {litki}, {rinci}; metaphorical use of {fepri} for gas, {risna} for liquid, {rinci}, {tutci})

column2: $x_{1}$ is an odor/fragrance/scent/smell emitted by $x_{2}$ and detected by observer/sensor $x_{3}$.
column3: An undetected emitter is odorless to the observer.  See also {nazbi}, {sumne}, {cpina}, {vrusi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (agent) punctuates $x_{2}$ (expression) with symbol/word $x_{3}$ with syntactic/semantic effect $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of sponge/porous material.
column3: Also metaphorically used for coral, Swiss cheese.  See also {cokcu} for a generalized absorbant.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a park/land reserve managed by community/polity/company $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a slice [thin flat portion] of $x_{2}$ (mass).
$x_{1}$ is at peace with $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ parallels $x_{2}$ differing only in property $x_{3}$ (ka; jo'u/fa'u term) by standard/geometry $x_{4}$.
column3: Also: $x_1$ is parallel to $x_2$, $x_3$ is the only difference between $x_1$ and $x_2$ (= {terpanra} for reordered places); $x_1$ and $x_2$ are alike/similar/congruent.   A parallel involves extreme close similarity/correspondence across the entirety of the things being compared, generally involving multiple properties, with focus placed on one or a small number of differences. See also {pa'a}, {mintu}, {simsa}, {girzu}, {vrici}.

column2: $x_1$ is a palm tree (Palmae/Arecaceae) of species $x_2$
$x_1$ palpates/palps/touch-feels $x_2$ (surface structure)
$x_1$ is a papaya (fruit) of species/variety/cultivar $x_2$
column3: {rutrpaupau} is the non-experimental synonym of “pamga”. See also {grute}.

column2: $x_1$ (activity/event) is profitless / unprofitable to $x_2$
$x_1$ (object) feels like (via touch) it has property $x_2$ (ka) to $x_3$ (observer)
$l_1$ (agent) washes dishes $l_2$ of soil/contaminant $l_3$ with cleaning material(s) $l_4$
$c_1$ is a dishwasher (machine).
$c_1$ in activity/state $c_2$ exhibits romantic orientation $c_3$ (ka) by standard $c_4$.
$x_1$ experiences so-called 'heartache'/love-pain.
column3: Possibly also includes love-sickness; so long as the experience is a psychological/emotional 'pain', anguish, grief, or other form of relatively intense discomfort derived from some form of love/limerence.

column2: $c_1$=$p_1$ lovingly looks at/views/regards/watches/gazes at $c_2$=$p_2$
column3: From la berenstein cribe 2020/11/17 See also {catlu}, {prami}

column2: $j_1$ hugs/embraces $j_2$ with $j_3$ (part of $j_1$) at locus $j_4$ (part of $j_2$).
$x_1$=$j_1$ romantically pursues $x_2$=$j_2$.
column3: Unlike {jersi}, implies volition for x1 but not necessarily x2. Does not imply "x1 pampe'o x2".
